metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2283 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libssh, where the authentication check of the connecting client can be bypassed in the`pki_verify_data_signature` function in memory allocation problems. This issue may happen if there is insufficient memory or the memory usage is limited. The problem is caused by the return value `rc,` which is initialized to SSH_ERROR and later rewritten to save the return value of the function call `pki_key_check_hash_compatible.` The value of the variable is not changed between this point and the cryptographic verification. Therefore any error between them calls `goto error` returning SSH_OK.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.9.3-2ubuntu2.3
libssh-gcrypt-4 - 0.9.3-2ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.3-2ubuntu2.3').
